content: I found this video that looks at the finical meltdown from one specific aspect, Short Selling and the demise of Bear Stearns and Lehman Brothers. I'm hardly financially sophisticated enough to give more than a layman's opinion. I just thought it makes as much sense as all the other finger pointing of who's to blame. Take a look and at the video and ask yourself if what is presented seems valid. I for one feel that the lack of oversight has allowed this to happen and we have to see that it doesn't continue and should never be allowed to again. If you agree pass the link on. >>>>http://antisocialmedia.net/?p=165 It's about 24 minutes long so anyone with a short attention span isn't going to get much out of it.

title: Short selling hedge funds and the global economic meltdown

content: It's not a matter of attention span for those who have 56k dialup. It takes hours to download 24 minutes of video. Got the text? "Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future." John F. Kennedy
